      • showStartAlert

        public java.lang.String showStartAlert()
        This function is fired to display an alert with 2 choices
        • Load : This choice will enable the user the load a previous instance
        • New : This choice will create a new instance and allow the user to bind key to class
        Returns:
        An empty string if the user clicks on new or cancel the FileChooser, or else the absolute path of the instance serialized

      • showExitAlert

        public void showExitAlert​(javafx.stage.WindowEvent event)
        This function shows an alert when call
        This alert is used to know if the user wants to quit, save & quit or cancel the operation
        Parameters:
        event - A WindowEvent to consume

      • loadQuestions

        private javafx.concurrent.Task<java.lang.Void> loadQuestions()
        Returns:
        a Task to load the question from the questions.ser in the resources

      • loadInstance

        private javafx.concurrent.Task<java.lang.Void> loadInstance​(java.lang.String filepath)
        Parameters:
        filepath - The absolute path to the instance
        Returns:
        a Task to load the instance

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main() method is ignored in correctly deployed JavaFX application. main() serves only as fallback in case the application can not be launched through deployment artifacts, e.g., in IDEs with limited FX support. NetBeans ignores main().
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
